TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit ApplicationId extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains information used to uniquely identify a manifest-based application. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An application identity consists of the publisher's public key, the application name, the target processor architecture, the application culture, and the application version. The application identity properties values correspond to information contained in the application manifest. For more information about the application manifest, see [ClickOnce Application Manifest](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/29570cec-4e53-4660-a850-abc4fa150243).
<xref:System.ApplicationId> is used by the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityInfo> class to identify a manifest-based application.
## Examples The following code example displays the <xref:System.ApplicationId> properties by obtaining the <xref:System.ApplicationId> from an <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityInfo> instance created using the <xref:System.ActivationContext> for the currently executing manifest-based application.
[!code-csharp[System.ApplicationIdentity#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.ApplicationIdentity/CS/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.ApplicationIdentity#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.ApplicationIdentity/VB/program.vb#1)]

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] publicKeyToken, string name, class System.Version version, string processorArchitecture, string culture) cil managed

Docs.param: The array of bytes representing the raw public key data.
A object that specifies the version of the application.
The processor architecture of the application.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The constructor initializes the <xref:System.ApplicationId.Culture%2A>, <xref:System.ApplicationId.Name%2A>, <xref:System.ApplicationId.ProcessorArchitecture%2A>, <xref:System.ApplicationId.PublicKeyToken%2A>, and <xref:System.ApplicationId.Version%2A> properties of the <xref:System.ApplicationId>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.ApplicationId Copy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current application identity.
Docs.returns: An object that represents an exact copy of the original.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The copy returned by this method is equal to the original as substantiated by the <xref:System.ApplicationId.Equals%2A> method. The hash codes for the original and the copy are also equal.

Docs.summary: Gets a string representing the culture information for the application.
Docs.value: The culture information for the application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ApplicationId.Culture%2A> value can include language information, for example, "en-US".
For information about culture values, see <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo>.
## Examples The following code example displays the <xref:System.ApplicationId.Culture%2A> property by obtaining the <xref:System.ApplicationId> from an <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityInfo> instance created using the <xref:System.ActivationContext> for the currently executing manifest-based application. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.ApplicationId> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the hash code for the current application identity.
Docs.returns: The hash code for the current application identity.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method generates the same hash code for two objects that have the same values for their <xref:System.ApplicationId.Name%2A> and <xref:System.ApplicationId.Version%2A> properties.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.ApplicationId.Name%2A> is the simple, unencrypted name of the application.
## Examples The following code example displays the <xref:System.ApplicationId.Name%2A> property by obtaining the <xref:System.ApplicationId> from an <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityInfo> instance created using the <xref:System.ActivationContext> for the currently executing manifest-based application. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.ApplicationId> class.

Docs.summary: Gets the target processor architecture for the application.
Docs.value: The processor architecture of the application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Valid values include "msil", "x86", "ia64", and "amd64". The default is "msil", or Microsoft intermediate language, which means all your assemblies are platform independent, and the common language runtime will compile them when they are needed by your application.
## Examples The following code example displays the <xref:System.ApplicationId.ProcessorArchitecture%2A> property by obtaining the <xref:System.ApplicationId> from an <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityInfo> instance created using the <xref:System.ActivationContext> for the currently executing manifest-based application. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.ApplicationId> class.
[!code-csharp[System.ApplicationIdentity#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.ApplicationIdentity/CS/program.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.ApplicationIdentity#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.ApplicationIdentity/VB/program.vb#9)]

Docs.summary: Gets the public key token for the application.
Docs.value: A byte array containing the public key token for the application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The public key token is represented by the last 8 bytes of the SHA-1 hash of the public key under which the application is signed.
For more information, see <xref:System.Reflection.AssemblyName.GetPublicKeyToken%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
## Examples The following code example displays the <xref:System.ApplicationId.PublicKeyToken%2A> property by obtaining the <xref:System.ApplicationId> from an <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityInfo> instance created using the <xref:System.ActivationContext> for the currently executing manifest-based application. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.ApplicationId> class.
